revised_title: Active Transport and Fluid Secretion in Insect Malpighian Tubules
tldr: This article discusses the process of fluid secretion by Malpighian tubules in insects. It explains how potassium ions enter the tubule cells and are actively pumped into the lumen, creating a trans-wall potential that allows passive movement of anions from the haemolymph into the lumen. The article also describes the role of apical and basal membranes in coupling ion and water movements, and how this process leads to the secretion of an iso-osmotic fluid.
